cards.name: Tungnath & Chandrashila
cards.summary: Highest Shiva temple trek with Himalayan views.
cards.detail: The trek to Tungnath and Chandrashila offers a spiritual and scenic journey through the Garhwal Himalayas. Starting from Chopta, this moderate trail winds through dense forests and alpine meadows before reaching Tungnath — the world’s highest Shiva temple. A further ascent to Chandrashila summit rewards trekkers with a breathtaking panoramic view of snow-capped Himalayan peaks including Nanda Devi, Trishul, and Kedarnath. This trek is ideal for beginners and nature lovers.

cards.name: Badrinath – Valley of Devotion
cards.summary: A sacred journey to a revered Himalayan temple.
cards.detail: Badrinath, one of the Char Dham pilgrimage sites, is nestled in the Nar-Narayan mountain ranges beside the Alaknanda River. This spiritual destination attracts thousands each year with its divine aura, natural beauty, and the iconic Badrinath Temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu. While most of the route is motorable, short nature walks around the area reveal hot springs, peaceful riverside ghats, and snow-capped views. Whether for devotion or exploration, Badrinath offers an unforgettable blend of faith and serenity.

cards.name: Kedarnath Trek
cards.detail: The Kedarnath trek is a spiritually uplifting trail that takes you to one of the holiest shrines in India — the Kedarnath Temple. Located at 11,755 feet, the temple stands amid the dramatic backdrop of snow-covered peaks and the Mandakini River. The 16 km trek from Gaurikund is steep yet scenic, with a mix of pine forests, waterfalls, and open meadows. It’s best attempted between May and October when weather conditions are favorable.
